title: Biodiversity of the Galapagos Island and Mainland Ecuador
description: As part of the Global Seminars Program, the course will be taught in Ecuador, where students will experience the biodiversity of the Galapagos Islands and mainland Ecuador, including how species compare, how they interact and evolve, human impact, the role of conservation, and genetic and molecular tools used for species monitoring. Students must apply and be accepted to the Global Seminars Program in order to enroll. Program or materials fees may apply. Prerequisites: BILD 1.
